def: the fourth month of the year, after March and before May
example: the 20th of April/April 20(th)|The meeting was held on the fourth of April/April fourth.|I took a course in London last April.|I'm taking a course in London next April.|We came back in April.

def: the eighth month of the year, after July and before September
example: the 13th of August/August 13(th)|We've got friends coming at the end of August.|They got married last August.|They're getting married next August.|It was one of the hottest Augusts on record.

def: compact disc: a small disc on which music or information is recorded
example: His CD collection is huge.

def: a machine that is used for playing music CDs
example: She has a CD player in her bedroom.

def: digital versatile disc or digital video disc: a disc used for storing and playing music, films or information
example: I've got a DVD of the first series.|Is the movie available on DVD?|a DVD player

def: the twelfth and last month of the year
example: the 23rd of December/December 23(rd)|Their baby was born last December.|Jonathan finishes his course next December.|My parents got married in/during December.|It was one of the coldest Decembers ever.

def: the second month of the year, after January and before March
example: the 28th of February/February 28(th)|I was born on the fifth of February/February fifth.|We moved into a new house last February|We are moving into a new house next February.|Building work is expected to start in February.

def: the day of the week after Thursday and before Saturday
example: Do you want to go to the theater on Friday?|I love Fridays because I leave work early.

def: used when the person speaking or writing is the subject of the verb
example: I love you.|Did I tell you about my vacation?|I'm not late, am I?|I'd like some coffee.

def: the first month of the year, after December and before February
example: Her father died in January.|His birthday is January 25th.|We go skiing in Germany every January.

def: the seventh month of the year, after June and before August
example: July 22(nd)|Ben's birthday is the eleventh of July.|next/last July|The film festival is in/during July.

def: the sixth month of the year, after May and before July
example: Her birthday is June 24th.|He arrived on the fifth of June/June the fifth.|last/next June|I went to visit my father in June.

def: the third month of the year, after February and before April
example: the 26th of March/March 26th|My birthday is March eleventh.|He retired last March.|We're going to Australia next March.|We'll get together in March.

def: the fifth month of the year, after April and before June
example: the 30th of May/May 30(th)|My mother's birthday is in May.|They came over last May.|We'll see her next May.

def: a title for a girl or woman who is not married, used before her family name or full name
example: Dr. White will see you now, Miss Carter.|Miss Helena Lewis

def: the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday
example: I start my new job on Monday.|I saw her last Monday.|We leave next Monday.|I was born on a Monday.

def: a title for a man, used before his family name or full name

def: a title for a married woman, used before her family name or full name
example: Mrs. Wood/Mrs. Jean Wood|Hello, Mrs. Grant, how are you today?|Please send your application to the finance director, Mrs. Laura Fox.

def: the eleventh month of the year, after October and before December

def: used when agreeing to do something or when allowing someone to do something
example: Could you pick me up at the train station? "OK, what time?"|"I'll pay you back tomorrow." "OK, no problem."

def: not sick, damaged, upset, etc.
example: Are you OK? You look pale.|How's Paola? Is she okay after her fall yesterday?|"Is everything OK with you?" "Yes, fine."|I'll just check that the car's okay - that was a big bang!

def: the tenth month of the year, after September and before November

def: the day of the week after Friday and before Sunday

def: the ninth month of the year, after August and before October
example: the 23rd of September/September 23(rd)|We're leaving for France on September ninth/the ninth of September.|Claudia started school last September/is starting school next September.|My mother's birthday is in September.

def: the day of the week after Saturday and before Monday

def: a piece of cotton clothing for the top part of the body with short sleeves and no collar
example: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt.

def: television
example: What's on TV tonight?|You watch too much TV!|We ate in front of the TV.|TV personalities

def: the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday

def: the day of the week after Monday and before Wednesday
example: We'll meet at eight on Tuesday.|We meet every Tuesday.|Tuesday afternoon|The twenty-ninth is a Tuesday, isn't it?

def: a set of pages of information on the Internet about a particular subject that have been published by the same person or organization and that often contain color pictures, video, and sound
example: For more information about other Cambridge titles, visit our Web site at www.cambridge.org.

def: the day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday
example: Did you say the meeting is on Wednesday?|The restaurant is always closed on Wednesdays.|Wednesday would be a good day for us to go running.

def: used before a noun to refer to a single thing or person but not a particular thing or person or not one that you have referred to before

def: used to mean any or every thing or person of the type you are referring to

def: one
example: a hundred dollars|a dozen eggs

def: used to state what type of thing or person something or someone is

def: used to refer to a time between twelve o'clock at night and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day

def: relating to a particular subject or person
example: What's she talking about?|I've got a book about Jung.

def: a little more or less than the stated number or amount

def: in or to a higher position than something else

def: an advertisement
example: TV/newspaper ads|a pop-up ad|I saw an ad for a part-time job that you might like.

def: the details of where a building is, including the building number, street name, city or town, etc.
example: her business/home address|a change of address

def: a series of letters, numbers or punctuation marks referring to a Web site or e-mail destination
example: Do you have their Web address?

def: a person or animal that has grown to full size and strength
example: Adults pay an admission charge but children get in free.

def: when a time or event has happened

def: the time between the middle of the day and the evening

def: once more
example: Could you spell your name again, please?|Throw it away and start again.

def: the number of years that someone has lived, or that something has existed

def: every person or thing in a group

def: the whole of a period of time

def: happening successfully or without problems

def: used to agree to a suggestion or request

def: in addition

def: every time, or at all times
example: I always walk to work.

def: used instead of "a" when the following word begins with a vowel sound

def: used to join two words, phrases, parts of sentences or related statements together
example: Ann and Jim|knives and forks|We kissed and hugged each other.|Straighten up your room. And don't forget to make your bed!

def: used to say that one thing happens after another thing
example: I got dressed and had my breakfast.

def: used when saying or adding numbers
example: It cost a hundred and twenty dollars.|Two and three equals five.

def: something that lives and moves but is not a human, bird, fish or insect
example: wild/domestic animals|She's a real animal lover.

def: what you say or write back to someone who has asked you a question or spoken to you
example: I asked him if he was going but I didn't hear his answer.|Please give me your answer by next week.

def: to speak or write back to someone who has asked you a question
example: You haven't answered my question.|I wrote asking whether he'd be coming to the party but he hasn't answered yet.|She answered that she wouldn't be able to come before nine o'clock.

def: used in questions and negatives to mean some
example: Is there any more soup? "No, I'm afraid there isn't any left."|I haven't seen any of his films.|I asked Andrew for some change but he hasn't got any.

def: one of or each of a particular kind of person or thing when it is not important which
example: Which of these cakes may I eat? "Any."|Any of you should be able to answer this question.|Any advice that you can give me would be greatly appreciated.|We should hear from him any minute/day/time now.|There were a lot of computers at the store, any (one) of which would have been fine for me.

def: used in questions or negatives to mean "something"
example: Is there anything I can do to help?|I didn't eat anything.|Did you notice anything strange about him?|Was there anything else you wanted to say?

def: any object, event, situation, etc.
example: Tom will eat anything!|We can do anything you like.

def: a hard, round fruit that has a green or red skin and is white inside
example: to peel an apple|apple pie/sauce|an apple tree

def: the long part at each side of the human body, ending in a hand
example: My arms ache from carrying this bag.|She put/threw her arms around me, and hugged me to her.|He took/held her in his arms.

def: used to talk about the job someone has

def: also

def: to say a question to someone which you want them to answer

def: used to show the place or position of something

def: used to show the time something happens

def: toward or in the direction of

def: the @ symbol, used in e-mail addresses to separate the name of a person, department, etc. from the name of the company

def: a very young child
example: a baby boy/girl|baby clothes|Sandra had a baby on May 29th.

def: where someone or something was before

def: unpleasant; causing difficulties or harm

def: a container made of paper, plastic, leather, etc., used for carrying things

def: a round object that you throw, kick, or hit in a game, or something with this shape

def: a long curved fruit with a yellow skin

def: a group of musicians who play modern music together

def: an organization or place where you can borrow money, save money, etc.

def: a specially shaped piece of wood used for hitting the ball in many games

def: when you wash your body in a bathtub

def: a room with a sink, a toilet, and often a bathtub and/or shower

def: used to say that someone or something exists

def: used to say or ask where someone or something is

def: an area of sand or small stones next to the ocean or a lake

def: a seed, or the pod containing seeds, of various climbing plants, eaten as a vegetable

def: the hair that grows on a man's chin

def: very attractive

def: very pleasant

def: a room used for sleeping in

def: being the darkest color there is, like the color of coal or of a very dark night

def: used to say how much bigger, better, worse, etc. one thing is than another thing

def: to make someone laugh or smile

def: to keep someone interested and help them to have an enjoyable time

def: showing that you think something is funny

def: to keep someone interested and help them to have an enjoyable time
example: How do you keep an 8-year-old boy amused?

def: the feeling that you have when something makes you smile or laugh

def: an enjoyable way of spending your time

def: the process of analyzing something

def: someone whose job is to study or examine something in detail

def: to examine the details of something carefully, in order to understand or explain it

def: a relative who lived a long time ago

def: anything that lives and moves, including people, birds, etc.

def: once every year

def: the feeling of being very worried

def: used when you are returning to an earlier subject

def: used in questions and negatives to mean "similar to"

def: into separate, smaller pieces

def: obvious or easy to notice

def: when something starts to exist or becomes available

def: a piece of computer software designed for a particular purpose

def: to relate to a particular person or situation
example: The same rules apply to everybody.|Those were old regulations - they don't apply any more.

def: to understand how good something is or how difficult it was
example: There's no point buying him expensive clothes - he doesn't appreciate them.|I don't think you appreciate how much time I spent preparing this meal.

def: used when you are thanking someone or showing that you are grateful

def: to come close in distance or time

def: to deal with something
example: I'm not sure how to approach the problem.

def: because of something

def: when considered as a group and not in parts

def: when you make a judgement about the quality, size or value, etc. of something

def: almost but not completely

def: a short explanation or an extra piece of information that is given at the bottom of a page or at the back of a book

def: to write something so that you do not forget it
example: I noted down their web address.

def: no other thing than

gw: have nothing to do with sb/sth

gw: be/have nothing to do with sb

def: without a successful result
example: I've come all this way for nothing.

def: a person who writes novels

def: used to show the length of time that something has been happening, from the time it began until the present

def: used to say that something will happen very soon

def: If something happens now and then, it happens sometimes but not very often.

def: as a result of a new situation

def: a long way from places where people live

def: If someone or something appears out of nowhere, it appears suddenly or unexpectedly.

def: relating to the energy that is released when the nucleus of an atom is divided

def: relating to weapons that use nuclear power
example: a nuclear war/attack|nuclear disarmament

def: several

def: a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work

def: the dry fruit of some trees which grows in a hard shell, and can often be eaten

def: a large tree found in northern countries, or the wood of this tree

def: to do what you are told to do by a person, rule, or instruction

def: to feel or say that you do not like or do not approve of something or someone

def: when someone says that they do not like or approve of something or someone

def: something that you are trying to achieve

def: only influenced by facts and not by feelings

def: to be forced to do something

def: to think about someone or something all the time

def: something or someone that you think about all the time

def: to get something

def: a time when something happens

def: sometimes but not often

def: a crime

def: someone with an important job in a military organization

def: used to show something which is used as food or fuel

def: used to give your opinion after you have considered all the facts about something

def: only if

def: a company that does a particular type of business

def: more similar ones

def: If someone or something appears out of nowhere, it appears suddenly or unexpectedly.

def: a thin, flat food made from flour, milk, and egg mixed together and cooked in a pan

def: to suddenly feel so worried or frightened that you cannot think or behave calmly, or to make someone feel this way

def: women's underwear which covers the bottom

def: the part of a job that involves producing reports, writing letters, organizing information, etc.

def: the scientific study of the way the human mind works and how it influences behavior, or the influence of a particular person's character on their behavior

def: relating to or involving people in general, rather than being limited to a particular group of people

def: in a place where other people, especially people you do not know, can hear you and see what you are doing

def: a book, magazine, newspaper or document in which information or stories are published

def: a company or person who prepares and prints books, newspapers, magazines, etc.

def: a sweet, soft food made from milk, sugar, eggs and flavoring and usually eaten cold

def: to take hold of something and use effort to move your body forward or up

def: If a vehicle pulls up, it stops, often for a short time.

def: when you hit someone or something with your fist

def: to hit someone or something with your fist

def: to cause something to stop

def: a situation or problem that needs to be dealt with or considered

def: in baseball or cricket, a single point

def: at a time that is far away in the future

def: being sad

def: able to understand what people are feeling and deal with them in a way that does not upset them

def: to give a punishment to someone who has committed a crime

def: to divide into parts, or to make something divide into parts

def: the decision of two people who were married to stop living together

def: a set of books published by the same company which deal with the same subject

def: needing or deserving your complete attention

def: the time and the place in which the action of a book, movie, play, etc. happens

def: to become blue, cold, nasty, etc.
example: The sky turned black and it started to rain.|The weather has suddenly turned cold.|When I refused to pay, he turned nasty.|She turned pale and started to shiver.

def: to return in the direction you have come from, or to make someone do this
example: They had to turn back because of the bad weather.

def: to refuse an offer or request

def: to happen in a particular way or to have a particular result, especially an unexpected one

def: to be known or discovered finally and surprisingly

def: If people turn out for an event, they go there.

def: to ask a person or organization for help or support
example: Eventually she turned to her aunt for help.|Her family lived a long way away, and she had no one to turn to.

def: to arrive or appear somewhere

def: a change in the direction in which you are moving or facing

def: When a number of people take turns, they do the same thing one after the other.
example: We take turns to answer the phone.|They all took turns carrying the suitcase.

def: someone who teaches one person or a very small group of people
example: a private tutor

def: to be aged between 20 and 29
example: Most of the staff are in their twenties.

def: the years 1920 through 1929
example: I love the fashions of the twenties.

def: in a way that shows all the characteristics that you would expect from the stated person, thing or group

def: better, greater or worse than all similar things

def: too bad to be allowed to continue

def: not beautiful or pleasant to look at

def: impossible to buy or get

def: not knowing about something

def: too painful or unpleasant for you to continue to experience

def: not probable and difficult to believe

def: not sure or not able to decide about something

def: not known or fixed, or not completely certain

def: in a state as though you are sleeping, for example because you have been hit on the head

def: in a particular state or condition

def: to think or understand a particular stated thing

def: to emphasize the truth or importance of something

def: under or below

def: knowledge about a subject, situation, etc. or about how something works

def: showing sympathy for someone's problems

def: not wearing any clothes

def: not true and morally wrong

def: unusual and special

def: not normal or right

def: not fair or acceptable

example: a vicious attack on a child|a vicious dog

def: intended to upset someone
example: a vicious rumor

def: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem which then makes the first problem worse
example: Many people get trapped in a vicious circle of dieting and weight gain.

def: a position from which something can be seen
example: The house was hidden from view behind a wall.|He turned the corner and the harbor came into view.

gw: take a dim view of sth
def: to disapprove of something
example: Most bosses take a dim view of long lunches.

def: to watch something
example: They were able to view the city from a helicopter.

def: to have a particular opinion about someone or something
example: The policy is so far viewed as a success.

def: to not obey a law, rule, or agreement
example: Countries that violate international law will be dealt with in court.

def: extreme force and energy, especially of something causing damage
example: Such was the violence of the explosion that three buildings collapsed.

def: sudden and causing damage
example: a violent explosion/storm

def: Virgin land, forest, etc. has not been used or damaged by people.

def: someone who has never had sex
example: She was a virgin at the time of her marriage.

def: because of something
example: She succeeded by virtue of hard work.

def: a good quality that someone has
example: Patience is not among his virtues.

def: an advantage or useful quality
example: The great virtue of having a small car is that you can park it easily.

def: behavior that is morally good
example: She was a woman of great virtue.

def: in a way that can be seen
example: He was visibly upset.

def: energy and strength
example: At 48, he still projects an image of youth and vitality.

def: in a very important way
example: Safety at work is vitally important.

def: A vivacious person, especially a woman, is full of energy and enthusiasm.
example: She is extremely vivacious.

def: a strong feeling that you are right for a particular type of work, or a job that gives you this feeling
example: He knew that teaching was his true vocation.

def: to say what you think about a particular subject
example: Opponents also voiced concern about potential traffic produced by the project.

def: a book, especially one of a set
example: a new dictionary in two volumes

def: If something speaks volumes, it makes an opinion, characteristic or situation very clear without the use of words.

def: If you do something voluntarily, nobody has forced you to do it.
example: She left voluntarily.

def: If someone vomits, the food or liquid that was in their stomach comes up and out of their mouth.

def: to vote

def: a person who votes or who has a legal right to vote, especially in an election

def: to make a serious promise or decision
example: They vowed (that) they would never forget her kindness.|I've vowed never to go there again.

def: a serious promise or decision
example: marriage vows|I made a vow that I would write to him once a week.

def: easy to hurt or attack physically or emotionally
example: She was a vulnerable sixteen-year-old.|The troops are in a vulnerable position.|He's more vulnerable to infection because of his injuries.

def: If someone's attention/mind, etc., wanders, they start thinking about one subject when they should be thinking about a different subject.
example: I was bored and my thoughts started to wander.

def: an attempt to stop something bad or illegal

def: a large building for storing goods that are going to be sold
example: We have several thousand of the books in our warehouse.

def: If you are wary of someone or something, you do not trust them completely.
example: She's still wary of strangers.

def: to be of a type or quality that someone will not understand or enjoy
example: Good coffee is wasted on Joe - he prefers instant.

gw: be (like) water off a duck's back
def: If criticisms, insults, etc., are like water off a duck's back to you, they do not affect you at all.
example: She calls him lazy and useless, but it's like water off a duck's back.

def: If you say that an argument doesn't hold water, you mean that it can't be true.
example: The jury convicted her because her story just didn’t hold water.

def: water from lakes, rivers, etc. that has no salt in it
example: These fish live in fresh water.

def: to have just enough money to live or to continue a business
example: With extra income from private sponsorship, the club is just about managing to keep its head above water.

def: If food makes your mouth water, it makes you want to eat it, sometimes making your mouth produce liquid.
example: The smells from the kitchen are making my mouth water.

def: a group of people or things that arrive or happen together or in a short period of time
example: There has been a wave of robberies in the region.|Another wave of people flowed into the theater.

def: when you suddenly feel an emotion
example: She felt a sudden wave of sadness.

def: to cause problems by asking difficult questions or criticizing
example: He has earned a reputation for making waves during political campaigns.

def: when you raise your hand and move it from side to side in order to attract someone's attention or to say hello or goodbye
example: She gave a little wave as the train left.

def: If two people are on the same wavelength, they have the same way of thinking and it is easy for them to understand each other.
example: We chatted occasionally, but I never really felt we were on the same wavelength.

def: the space needed for a particular movement or action
example: Sorry, am I in your way? I'll move.|If you don't move that vase out of the way, it might get broken.|Don't let your new friends get in the way of your studies.|I couldn't see the stage because there was a pillar in the way.|Please make way so the ambulance can get by.

def: to be successful and make progress in your work
example: He managed to make his way in the film industry.

gw: go out of your way to do sth
def: to try very hard to do something pleasant for someone
example: He went out of his way to make us feel welcome.

gw: get/have sth out of the way

example: I'll go shopping when I've got this essay out of the way.

def: used to say that someone or something does something to a large degree
example: They celebrate birthdays in a big way.

def: to be already happening
example: Building work is already under way.

def: If something gives way, it falls because it is not strong enough to support the weight on top of it.
example: Suddenly the ground gave way under me.

def: to be replaced by someone or something
example: They knocked down the old houses to make way for a new hotel.

def: If something paves the way for something else, it makes the other thing possible.

def: to learn something by experiencing a lot of problems or difficulty
example: He doesn’t want to take my advice, so I guess he’ll have to learn the hard way.

def: to move carefully through a crowded place, changing direction in order to avoid people or things
example: She threaded her way through the crowd.

def: to become less certain or determined about a decision, or to make someone less determined
example: I told him I wouldn't give him any more money, but then I weakened.

def: to like a particular thing or person very much
example: She has a real weakness for ice cream.

def: a large amount of something good
example: a wealth of experience/information

def: to show a particular emotion on your face.
example: He was wearing a smile/frown.

def: If a feeling or explanation starts to wear thin, it becomes weaker or harder to accept.
example: I've warned you several times about being late and my patience is wearing thin.

def: very tired
example: You look weary, my love.

def: bored with something or someone
example: She grew weary of the children and their games.

def: to feel ill
example: I'm feeling a little under the weather this morning.

def: a wild plant that you do not want to grow in your yard, garden, or field
example: Dandelions are common weeds.

def: to cry, usually because you are sad
example: She covered her face with her hands and wept.

def: to work as hard as other people in a group
example: The rest of the team complained that Sarah wasn't pulling her weight.

def: to be considered important and effective in influencing someone
example: His opinions carry a lot of weight with the scientific community.

def: to stay somewhere too long so that people want you to leave
example: I don't want to outstay my welcome.

def: help, especially money, given by the government to people who are poor or do not have jobs
example: She works in child welfare.|The family had to go on welfare.

def: used to say that something is not a suitable or practical thing to do
example: I couldn't very well tell her while he was there.

def: to intend to be helpful or kind but cause problems instead
example: He means well, but he keeps trying to help with things he doesn't really understand.

def: used to talk about the reasons for a particular situation, especially a bad or difficult situation
example: I'm tired, what with traveling all day yesterday and sleeping badly.

def: every time or any time
example: Will it be okay if I do it tomorrow? "Sure, whenever."|Do it in a spare moment at the weekend or whenever - it really doesn't matter.

def: what someone thinks about you, how they expect you to behave, and how they are likely to behave
example: He didn’t even send me a birthday card, so I guess I know where I stand.

def: what your opinion is about something
example: The Senator has made it clear where she stands on these issues.

def: used to ask in what place or area someone or something is
example: Whereabouts does he live?

def: the place where someone or something is
example: His whereabouts are unknown.

def: by which
example: They've introduced a system whereby people can pay back their loans slowly over time.

def: when you suddenly want to do something without having a reason
example: We booked our beach vacation on a whim.

def: having a pale face because you are ill or you are feeling shocked
example: He was white with shock.

def: relating to white people
example: the white community

def: as a single object and not in pieces
example: The baby bird swallowed the worm whole.

def: in a completely enthusiastic way
example: I agreed wholeheartedly with what she said.

def: completely
example: His behavior is wholly unacceptable.

def: extremely bad and morally wrong
example: a wicked man

def: to be completely awake
example: Is Oliver awake yet? "Yes, he's wide awake and running around his bedroom."

def: to hold a weapon or tool and look as if you are going to use it
example: They were confronted by a man wielding a knife.

def: to have a lot of influence or power over other people
example: People in his position wield a lot of power over our lives.

def: If someone, especially a child, runs wild, they behave as they want to and no one controls them.
example: Their nine-year-old son is left to run wild.

def: If someone's imagination runs wild, they are not able to control their thoughts.
example: It was getting dark and my imagination was starting to run wild.

def: something that you say which is not based on facts or careful thought
example: I’ll make a wild guess but I don't really know.|You can't go round making wild accusations like that.

def: with a lot of wind, rain, etc.
example: a wild and stormy night

def: bigger or better than anything you could imagine or hope for
example: The house was beyond my wildest dreams.

def: used to say that something is better than anything you could imagine or hope for
example: Never in my wildest dreams had I thought I would be offered a starring role in a Hollywood movie.

def: a place that is in a completely natural state without houses, industry, roads, etc.
example: a beautiful mountain wilderness

def: extremely
example: It's a wildly popular video game.|The product has been wildly successful.

def: an official statement of what a person has decided should be done with their money and property after their death
example: Have you made a will yet?|She left me some money in her will.

def: wanting to do something
example: He is a very willing assistant.

def: the ability to make yourself do difficult things or to stop yourself from doing enjoyable things that are bad for you
example: It takes great willpower to lose weight.

def: to get approval/respect/support, etc. because of your skill and hard work

def: to take a risk
example: I decided to throw caution to the wind and book a ticket to India.

def: a group of people in an organization or political party who have the same beliefs

def: to quickly close and then open one eye, in order to be friendly or to show that something is a joke
example: She smiled and winked at me.

def: to not have any sleep
example: I was so excited last night - I didn't sleep a wink.

def: to destroy something completely

def: something that you say secretly to yourself about what you want to have or happen

def: without using any type of tool or weapon when doing something that requires a lot of strength
example: He wrestled the lion to the ground with his bare hands.

def: in an excited or anxious way
example: I waited with bated breath as the results were read out.

def: If you do or say something with a heavy heart, you feel very sad or anxious
example: It was with a heavy heart that he packed his bags and left his home of many years.

def: used by someone to express good wishes when they give you something free, for example in a restaurant
example: Please accept this champagne with the compliments of the manager.

def: to decide that you will not now be in a race, competition, etc.

def: when you take money out of a bank account

def: when something is taken away so that it is no longer available, or when someone stops being involved in an activity

def: quiet and not talking to other people
example: As winter dragged on, he seemed sadder and more withdrawn.

def: to not be harmed or broken by something
example: a bridge designed to withstand earthquakes

def: an area of land with a lot of trees
example: A lot of the area is woodland.

def: to talk to someone for a short time

def: using the exact words that were originally used

def: used when you repeat what someone said

def: to be so surprised, angry or moved by something that you do not know what to say

def: not knowing what to say
example: The question was unexpected and she was temporarily at a loss for words.

def: by one person telling another telling you

def: someone who works too much and does not have time to do anything else

def: all the people in a country who are able to do a job

def: to be of extremely good quality

gw: do sb a world of good

gw: not be the end of the world

gw: be/feel on top of the world
def: to be very happy
example: I had just won a major tournament and I was feeling on top of the world.

def: the way a person prays or the religious ceremonies people attend

def: to worry that something very bad will happen or that something very bad has happened

def: If it is worth your while doing something, it is useful or enjoyable to do it.

def: having no value in money
example: The painting's a fake - it's completely worthless.

def: deserving to be given attention, noticed, etc.

def: would prefer

def: wanting or trying to be

def: to destroy or badly damage something

def: a vehicle or ship that has been destroyed or badly damaged

def: someone who is in a bad physical or mental condition

def: the parts that remain of a car, ship, or aircraft that has been destroyed

def: very unhappy or ill

def: very bad or of poor quality

def: a small line on your face that you get when you grow old

def: to decide that someone or something is not useful or important

gw: get/start off on the wrong foot

def: used when you do not want someone to think that you do not like someone or something

def: extreme dislike or fear of people from other countries

gw: yearn for sth; yearn to do sth

example: They yearned for peace.|She yearned to get away.

def: used to show that you are surprised or annoyed that something is being repeated or increased

def: used to say there is still a possibility that something will happen

def: to not have done something that was expected before this time

def: to produce or provide something
